definition: thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Here I need to put a long series of ellipsis so I account for no details.
sentences.chinese: 后来就是一长串的省略号，就不细说了。

sentences.english: Because the task of confidentiality, liu town cant elaborate.
sentences.chinese: 因为任务的保密原则，柳时镇无法细说。

sentences.english: Given an audience with President Lincoln, he discoursed at length on the high and ancient nobility of his distinguished family.
sentences.chinese: 他不厌其烦细说自己家世显赫，自古就是高门贵族。

sentences.english: He added that Sanad might have "foreign links, " without elaborating.
sentences.chinese: 他还说萨那德可能有“国外网络连接”，但并未细说。

sentences.english: Mind not elaborate, aesthetic long will be tired, change is in the affirmative.
sentences.chinese: 心思不用细说，审美久了都邑委靡，换口味是肯定的。

definition: to say more than is necessary/to give unnecessary details
start explaining and it's a long story (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
the rise and fall of the terrain (idiom)/(fig.) the whole sequence of events/causes and effects
to return to the topic (idiom)/to get back to the main point
to make a long story short (idiom)
to omit/to delete/to leave out/to neglect/to skip over
